name: Protect sensitive data in config files from disclosure
description: This rule raises a violation when loading sensible data using the OpenStack framework without the protection flag. This rule is compliant with CWE-522, OWASP 2013 2017 A2 recommendations.
output:
Line and column for each violation.
Associated value => number of violations found
rationale: Frameworks offer many flags in their APIs to properly handle sensible data. Using them is particularly important to avoid accidental exposition of loaded passwords through accidental debug logging.
remediation: Add the ‘secret=True’ flag to the ‘cfg.StrOpt()’ function when registering the oslo configuration.
remediationSample:
cfg.StrOpt('myPassword123',
                 help='pss',
                 secret=True) # sanitize and protection
